intro: Styphelia florulenta, commonly known as the slender leek or fairy leek, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in heathland and coastal scrub environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Styphelia florulenta is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can tolerate salty sea breezes. Its delicate appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
